content: hot lines v1 1 p 1 hot lines lorraine waitman january 2020 do you like it when lines meld and change creating new patterns i do this little cowl uses different sequences of knits and purls to create lines that move and change and then change back across the cowl leaving one or two buttons unbuttoned allows the cowl to drape over your collar just a bit this cowl can also be reversible by adding a set of similarly sized buttons on the wrong side yarn worsted weight yarn approx 220 yds a yarn that has good stitch definition will allow the ridges to show up to advantage photographed cowl knit in whole knit n caboodle woot- worsted 220 worsted weight superwash 100% merino wool 220 yds gauge measured in k1/p1 rib 20 stitches/4 inches after blocking notions us7 needles five ½ buttons 10 buttons if you want to make it reversible tapestry needle for weaving in ends needle and thread to sew on buttons finished dimensions after blocking length approximately 22 inches height approximately 10 inches pattern instructions set up co 51 sts using a long tail cast on or other cast on of your choice note if a deeper or narrower cowl is desired cast on a number divisible by 3 where the result is an odd number stitch count remains the same throughout this project hot lines v1 1 p 2 section 1 - button band garter stitch r1 rs k all stitches r2 ws k all stitches repeat row r1 and r2 three 3 more times to create 4 garter ridges section 2 k1/p1 rib r1 rs k3 pm k1 p1 to last 4 sts k1 pm k3 r2 ws k3 sm p1 k1 to last 4 sts p1 sm k3 repeat row 1 and 2 slipping markers as you come to them for 2 inches ending on a ws row section 3 k3/p3 rib r1 rs k3 sm k3 p3 seven times k3 sm k3 r2 ws k3 sm p3 k3 seven times p3 sm k3 repeat row 1 and 2 slipping markers as you come to them for 5 inches ending on a ws row section 4 variant rib r1 rs k3 sm k3 p1 k1 p1 seven times k3 sm k3 r2 ws k3 sm p3 k1 p1 k1 seven times p3 sm k3 repeat row 1 and 2 for 7 inches ending on a ws row section 5 repeat section 3 k3/p3 rib for 5 inches ending on a ws row section 6 repeat section 2 k1/p1 rib for 2 inches ending on a ws row section 7 button hole band garter stitch r1 rs k all stitches r2 ws k all stitches repeat r1 and r2 one more time create buttonholes on r5 as instructed below r5 rs k2 yo k2 decrease k9 four times yo k2tog k3 r6 ws k all stitches r7 rs k all stitches bind off and weave in tails finishing block the work blocking will allow
